title: Aldi Australia hair straightening brush shoppers are going wild for
text:
For many women, it's the ultimate beauty weapon to banish frizz, remove knots and get sleek locks in seconds.

And Aldi Australia is set to sell a hair straightening brush for just $25, with fans comparing the budget item to high-end models that cost nine times the retail price.

As part of its Special Buys sale on Wednesday, October 23, the product features adjustable temperature control up to 200°C, ceramic coated plates, fast heat-up and a sleep mode after 60 minutes.

Shoppers who got their hands on the appliance from the previous sale are raving about the anti-static technology - as others shared their glowing results.

Aldi Australia is set to sell a hair straightening brush for just $25, with fans comparing the budget item to high-end models that cost nine times the retail price (pictured a shopper showing off her incredible results after getting her hands on the Aldi product)

As part of its Special Buys sale on October 23, the product features adjustable temperature control up to 200°C, ceramic coated plates, fast heat-up and a sleep mode after 60 minutes

Many Australian customers revealed they were very happy with the purchase, while others said if you wanted 'dead straight' hair, you're better off with a hair straightener.

Talitha said: 'Purchased last time, black version. Absolutely love it. If you like well kept but not dead straight, yes this is worth it. Think more blow dry styled.'

Isha said: 'I love it as easy and convenient to use when in rush. But it doesn't give you dead straight.'

Ange said: 'The one I have from the last time is amazing. I bought two. If you're after dead straight hair though, you must use a straightener after because none of these brushes actually do that.'

Samantha said: 'I find it hard to brush through my thick coarse hair, but it does an okay job.'

Michelle was also impressed with her purchase, as she shared 'before' and 'after' pictures of her hair transformation, saying: 'The hair brush straightener works great'

And Alexandra said: 'Isn't electric straight like a GHD but it's nice.'

Many women from around the world who also got their hands on an Aldi hair straightening brush shared their incredible results on social media.

'Holy wow do I love it! It's so fast and way more comfortable to use than a straightener,' Debbie said.

'My hair is naturally just curly enough that it looks messy/frizzy. But now? In five minutes I'm sleek. Smooth. Put together. I love it. [I'm now] wearing my hair down regularly for the first time in years.'

Michelle was also impressed with her purchase, as she shared 'before' and 'after' pictures of her hair transformation, saying: 'The hair brush straightener works great.'
